description: Triangle of coefficients from fractional iteration of e^x - 1.
comments: The triangle reflects the Jordan-decomposition of the matrix of Stirling numbers of the second kind. A display of the matrix formula can be found at the Helms link which also explains the generation rule for the A()-numbers in a different way. - _Gottfried Helms_ Apr 19 2014
references: L. Comtet, Advanced Combinatorics, Reidel, 1974, p. 148.
formula: G.f. A(n;x) for n-th row satisfies A(n;x) = Sum_{k=0..n-1} Stirling2(n, k)*A(k;x)*x, A(1;x) = 1. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Jan 02 2004
mathematica: a[n_, x_] := Sum[ StirlingS2[n, k]*a[k, x]*x, {k, 0, n-1}]; a[1, _] = 1; Table[ CoefficientList[ a[n, x], x] // Rest, {n, 2, 10}] // Flatten (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Dec 11 2012, after _Vladeta Jovovic_ *)
crossrefs: Diagonals give A008827, A006472, A059355. Row sums are A005121.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 15 1996
